intro: Paronychia bonariensis, commonly known as the mountain holly or evergreen holly, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while its flowers are usually white or pink, appearing in clusters. Paronychia bonariensis is often used in ornamental gardening for its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
